results.title: Grease
results.creator_credit: A H Luff, Frank Thrower and Shell
results.brief_description: All machinery depends on bearings. Ball and roller bearings are made with the utmost care and precision. All this effort is wasted if lubricants in which they run to don’t stand up to their work. This film illustrates how different types of grease are manufactured to meet different needs; additives being put in to adapt greases for special purposes. Tests are carried out during the manufacture of grease to ensure uniformity of quality and reliability of performance.

results.title: Gravity is my enemy
results.brief_description: A documentary on painter, Mark Hicks, a man essentially without nerve or muscle function below the neck. Examines his skill, his images, his life and others’ perception of him.

results.title: Gravity
results.brief_description: A variety of everyday experiences are used as an introduction to the study of the principles of gravity. Major effects of gravity on our solar system, tides and effect of distance on gravitational pull are demonstrated and explained.

results.title: Grassland farming
results.creator_credit: Donald Wilder, Julian Biggs and Canada. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Helps the farmer assess his grassland farming practices and suggests ways of increasing gains. Shows why grass is the most economical livestock feed to grow and notes its importance in soil conservation. Shows how to start a good grass forage crop, the fertilizer to use, and the strip grazing method of permanent pasture using a moveable electric fence to allocate a fresh area daily.

results.title: The Grasshopper and the ant
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Carl Koch and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: An example of the silhouette films of Lotte Reineger, based on the poem of La Fontaine. All summer long Grasshopper plays his fiddle for other animals and insects to dance, but Mrs. Ant, busy collecting fuel and food, criticises him for his levity. When winter comes he is near death from cold and hunger when a squirrel and a mouse take him in and care for him. He recovers and all including Mrs. Ant join in dancing to his fiddle. Music by Freddie Phillips.

results.title: Grasshopper: Anatomy and dissection
results.brief_description: Extreme close-up views and step-by-step dissection show in detail the external and internal anatomy pf the lubber grasshopper. The distinctive, circulatory, excretory, nervous, respiratory and reproductive systems are traced in the insect and on matching anatomical diagrams. Natural habitat scenes relate the structures to their functions.

results.title: Grass and conservation
results.brief_description: Grass is indirectly involved in the production of many essentials commodities - butter, milk, meat, clothes, blankets and soap. Therefore its incorrect use could upset the present and future prosperity of the country. Methods of grass conservation include prevention of overgrazing, extermination of rabbits, and other pests, planting of grass and trees on damaged land and the instruction of young farmers in conservation practices.

results.title: Graphs correlation regression elasticity (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Deals with a study of the principles by which resources are allocated and production organised. Andrew Pollard examines a number of statistical tools frequently used by economists. These include the graph, regression and multiple regression

results.title: Grapevine pruning
results.brief_description: The method of pruning sultana grapes developed as a result of research on vine buds and shoots, is shown. The correct methods of pruning Zante currants, Gordos, and other varieties of grapes is also shown. The research work was carried out by CSIRO at the Commonwealth Research Station, Merbein, Victoria.

results.title: Grapes are growing
results.creator_credit: Peter Menzies, John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australia’s wine industry. Shows the factors leading to high quality grapes; the process of wine making in which grapes are tested, weighed, transported, crushed, fermented, stored and bottled ready for use. Includes the traditional method of making ‘champagne’ and the importance of the Australian Wine Research Institute and Roseworthy College.
